page.title: 11Crane Moor 3
page.content: The Old Tavern is one of Crane Moor's oldest houses and it used to be a public house. It was called the Victoria Tavern and Abraham Firth was the owner and landlord. In a photograph of 1898 it had a pointed roof where now it slopes upthe other way,and what is now the side used tobe the front.The house is made of stone with little patches of brick and stone slates. Some of the stones are blackened because there was a fire. There was astable at the back of the tavern where the travellers could change their horses,but now we have taken it down because we are going to build an extension later this year.Our house is in Pog Lane and we look down on Crane Moor village.
